description: Smallest number whose cube is divisible by n.
links: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
F. Smarandache, Collected Papers, Vol. II, Tempus Publ. Hse, Bucharest, 1996.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Smarandache Ceil Function
formula: Replace any cubic factors in n by their cube roots.Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^ceil(e/3). - _R. J. Mathar_, May 29 2011
maple: f:= n -> mul(t[1]^ceil(t[2]/3), t = ifactors(n)[2]):map(f, [$1..100]); # _Robert Israel_, Sep 22 2015
prog: (PARI)  a(n)=my(r=1);while(r^3%n!=0,r++);r \\ _Anders Hellstr√∂m_, Sep 22 2015(Sage) [prod([t[0]^(ceil(t[1]/3)) for t in factor(n)]) for n in range(1,79)] # _Danny Rorabaugh_, Sep 22 2015
author: R. Muller
extensions: Corrected and extended by _David W. Wilson_
